title: LIVE! with Q&A: Is the Masoretic Text the Oldest Hebrew Bible Text? with @CrossBibleOfficial  üì±
description:
For a long time it was claimed that the Masoretic Text preserved the oldest, standardised version of the "biblical" text, and was secured in the Jerusalem Temple for centuries prior to Jesus. But, the Dead Sea Scrolls changed everything we thought we knew about the transmission of biblical texts, and revealed a world of dynamic, fluid pluriformity wherever Jewish texts were copied and read.

Today I am joined by Stephen Nelson, founder of @CrossBibleOfficial to delve into this question of textual priority and textual criticism as we respond to a video in a series produced by@AlephwithBeth and based on a recent article by Hebrew Bible text critic, Peter Gentry.

Here's the original video: https://youtu.be/R8ocH-0Q5Hs?si=kw7OOSwqnrunImdE
Subscribe to Stephen's channel, and support his work @CrossBibleOfficial

title: LIVE! with Q&A: Richard Carrier is Probably Wrong about the Crucifixion
description:
One of the enduring features of early Christianity is that Jesus was crucified‚Äîit's central to the message of Paul, our earliest witness to Christian beliefs. In his book, "On the Historicity of Jesus," Carrier has challenged conventional thinking about what it meant to the first Christians that Jesus was "crucified," and‚Äîas with many things‚Äîhas stretched his usage of the word to such an extreme vagueness as to make it unhelpfully imprecise, and practically meaningless.
Join me and @Vishanti as we perform some live philology.

title: LIVE! with Q&A: Reconstructing the War Scroll‚ÄîA Dead Sea Scrolls Primer
description:
The Dead Sea Scrolls are comprised of tens of thousands of fragments, and most of the work by scholars over the last near-century since there discovery has been putting together this frustratingly incomplete jigsaw puzzle. One of the most captivating texts in the Scrolls is The War Scroll‚Äîa collection of rituals, songs instructions and inventories for fighting the war between the Sons of Light and Darkness in the Last Days. The War Scroll was found in Cave 1Q, but there were also copies discovered in Cave 4Q, including 4Q491.
This is a lecture that I gave in G√∂ttingen in 2017 about the process, problems and some of the surprising and interesting results in working with fragmentary manuscripts. Using 4Q491 as a test case, I show how much this manuscript has been misunderstood by scholars, and how much a careful reconstruction changes our perspective of The War Scroll.

As always, Q&A will follow. Superchat for priority.

title: Does this Dead Sea Scrolls Fragment Predict the Crucifixion of Jesus?
description:

Find out for yourself ...

title: LIVE! with Q&A: Genesis, Genealogies and the Composition of the Pentateuch
description:
Adam is said to have lived for 930 years; Enoch "walked with God, and was taken"; Methuselah enjoys a reputation in many corners of this globe as the oldest human ever to live. This is all from what we read in the so-called "Sethite Genealogy" in Genesis 5, but what is really going on in this text?

Join me and  @Vishanti  and we're going to dive in and explore this fascinating text, which also carries with it implications for the date of the Book of Genesis and the Pentateuch.

... also, MATH!

As always, Q&A will follow. Superchat for priority.

title: LIVE! with Q&A: YHWH's Cover-Up in Isaiah's Throne Vision‚Äîwith Pat Lowinger
description:
In Isaiah 6:1, the Prophet says: "In the year that King Uzziah died I saw YHWH sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and his ****** filled the temple."

Almost all translators and biblical scholars tell us that while a puzzling word used here, it most likely refers to the enormous length of YHWH's robes, which seem to overwhelm Isaiah. But Francesca Stavrakopoulou has most recently revived an older, much more scandalous reading of this story that practically set the Refromed- and Ortho-Bros collective hair and giant beards on fire.

So, what did Isaiah actually see, when he saw his vision of God? Join me, @Vishanti and my friend Pat Lowinger from @discoveringancienthistoryw5246  for a deep-dive into this text to answer that question.

As always, Q&A will follow. Superchat for priority.

title: LIVE! with Q&A: John Allegro, conspiracies and the Bible‚Äîwith Matthew Goff and Geoffrey Smith
description:
John M. Allegro is most famously the author of the controversial book, "The Cross and the Sacred Mushroom, " but he cut his teeth as one of the first members of the scholarly team who published the Dead Sea Scrolls. Matthew Goff is a friend who has recently written a new article about Allegro and his legacy, and he joins me along with New Testament scholar Geoffrey Smith, to talk about it. 

Geoffrey Smith is an Associate Professor and Fellow of the Louise Farmer Boyer Chair in Biblical Studies; he is the Director of the Institute for the Study of Antiquity and Christian Origins at UT Austin, and has written several books about early Christianity. His most recent title is with Brent Landau, "The Secret Gospel of Mark: A Controversial Scholar, a Scandalous Gospel of Jesus, and the Fierce Debate over Its Authenticity."

Matthew Goff is Professor of Religion and Distinguished Research Professor in the Religions of Western Antiquity Faculty at FSU. He is a Dead Sea Scrolls specialist and a long time friend. His most recent book is "The Apocrypha: A Guide."

Buy Matthew's new book, "The Apocrypha: A Guide": https://a.co/d/6A8mfb3

title: Who Forged the Dead Sea Scrolls? A conversation with Prof. Erin Thompson
description:
Between 1996‚Äì2014, private collectors managed to successfully purchase over a hundred fragments claimed to belong to the Dead Sea Scrolls, and nearly all of them have turned out to be modern forgeries. After millions of dollars changed hands, years of scholarly promotion followed by investigation, and eventually embarrassing lawsuits, the story of the post-2002 Dead Sea Scrolls-like forgeries is a cautionary tale about provenance, trafficking, devotion and greed. Who was behind this shocking fraud?

Join me and @Vishanti for a special live discussion with Erin Thompson, America's only professor of art crime at CUNY, who is currently working on a fascinating book project that tracks this incredible tale among others in the shady world of antiquities markets.

Prof. Thompson will be on hand to answer your questions at the end of the show. Superchat for priority.

Find out more about Erin Thompson, and check out her books: https://www.artcrimeprof.com/

title: LIVE! with Q&A: The composition of the Pentateuch ‚Äî A conversation with Prof. David M. Carr
description:
There are plenty of online Christian apologetic channels who are determined to have us all believe that modern, critical theories about the origins and formation of the Torah and the rest of the Bible are baseless nonsense; that Moses wrote the Pentateuch, and all the claims of traditional authorship and history in the texts can be accepted on the face of it. Dr. Carr will be available to answer audience questions following our conversation.

title: Canaan in the Late Bronze Age: A conversation with Prof. Amihai Mazar
description:
Does the archaeological picture of Canaan at the end of the Bronze Age support the biblical narrative of the Conquest in the Book of Joshua? This has been frequently and loudly claimed by apologists @InspiringPhilosophy But, recently, my colleague Dr. Joshua Bowen from @DigitalHammurabi and I had the rare opportunity to discuss these issues with a luminary in the field to set the record straight.

Amihai Mazar is Professor Emeritus in the Institute of Archaeology, The Hebrew University of Jerusalem, and the holder of the Eleazar Sukenik Chair of Archaeology. He was the director of excavations at Tell Qasile, Tel Batash (biblical Timnah), Tel Beth Shean and Tel Rehov. His primary fields of research are in the Levant of the Bronze and Iron Ages, the periods of Israelite emergence and statehood, and the relationship between archaeology and the Hebrew Bible. Prof. Mazar has written and published prolifically, including his bestselling Archaeology of the Land of the Bible (1990) and The Quest for the Historical Israel (2007, with Israel Finkelstein). He is the former editor of Qadmoniot (1994‚Äì1995), and was a co-editor of the Israel Exploration Journal (2010‚Äì2015). He is the recipient of the Israel Prize in Archaeological Research (2009), and a member of the Israel Academy of Sciences.

00:00 Introduction
04:25 Interview with Prof. Mazar
40:00 Post-interview discussion about a 2023 publication by Lorenzo Nigro

title: LIVE with @ChristianityOnTheSpectrum-k1y: Autism, Christian Apologetics and "The Chosen"
description:
We are delighted to have Jon Machnee on the show today, the writer and producer of the fabulous new podcast, @ChristianityOnTheSpectrum-k1y.

Jon led a 10-year ethnographic study of autistic Christians and ex-Christians and their relationship to modern Christianity. It covers data from around 26,000 autistics online posting and over 500 long form interviews. It is the largest, most comprehensive ethnographic survey of this specific sub-culture and how they interact with Christianity.

In today's show, Jon will summarise his work and his findings, and we will more narrowly discuss the intersection of his research with my own scholarly appraisals of Christian apologetics. We will also spend some time talking about the popular Christian television show, "The Chosen," and the decision made by the writers and directors to portray the Apostle Matthew character as aneurotypical.

As always, a Q&A will follow; superchat for priority.

Subscribe to @ChristianityOnTheSpectrum-k1y .

title: YHWH is gaslighting you: a conversation about child sacrifice with Dr. Heath Dewrell, Part 2
description:
YHWH wants Abraham to sacrifice his son, changes his mind, provides for offering child sacrifices to him in Exodus 22, and then calls these laws "not good" in Ezekiel 20.

What the hell?

Dr.  @JoelKorytko  is a faculty member at Northwest Seminary & College in Langley, Canada, and he has recently forwarded arguments about two particular texts in the Bible, which seem to suggest that YHWH approved of child sacrifice. title: Reading the Book of Joshua with Dr. Mark Leuchter and @DigitalHammurabi: What Apologists Get Wrong
description:
My colleague, Dr. Joshua Bowen, and I are excited to welcome Dr. Mark Leuchter from Temple University for this discussion about historical and literary methods, and how Christian apologists and scholars fail in their application.

We will be responding to portions of a livestream with @InspiringPhilosophy and @ancientegyptandthebible, where they attempted to make the case for an historical Conquest as told in the Book of Joshua. With Dr. Leuchter's help, we will explore several of their erroneous presuppositions, historical and philological blunders, and show why apologetic approaches to the biblical texts are unconvincing and distracting to scholars.

Mark Leuchter (Ph.D., Toronto) is Professor of Jewish Studies, and the Director of the Jewish Studies Program at Temple University. His work includes the study of mythology in ancient Israel and Second Temple Judaism, the phenomenon of prophecy in the ancient near east, the formation of the Hebrew Bible, and the history of the Israelite priesthood.

As always, a Q&A will follow‚Äîsuperchat for priority.

title: Who is Josh McDowell?
description:
Josh McDowell is one of the most recognisable Evangelical apologists of the last half-century, and he is renowned in part for his usage of ancient manuscript studies to fortify a number of his exaggerated claims about the New Testament and Christianity. McDowell is a private manuscript collector in his own right, and he involved himself in the recent controversy surrounding the popularisation of a supposedly first-century manuscript fragment of the Gospel of Mark.
https://youtu.be/uC_SgXKYjk4

Follow the link, and join Dr. Kipp Davis as he tracks McDowell‚Äôs history with ancient manuscripts parallel to the recent history of controversial biblical manuscript finds and forgeries, and deconstructs how he has manipulated this history to rewrite his own conversion narrative.

"Josh McDowell: Manuscript Hunting and Mythmaking for Jesus" was produced with funding from the "Lying Pen of Scribes" NFR FRIPRO Toppforsk Project at the University of Agder.

title: What is a "Biblical Text", Anyways? The Dead Sea Scrolls, Unapologetically 1.3.
description:
This is the third instalment in the comprehensive series "The Dead Sea Scrolls, Unapologetically," and the final video in Part 1 about the so-called "biblical scrolls" at Qumran.

In this video Dr. Kipp Davis attempts to address the questions surrounding the evidence for the biblical text at Qumran. How did scholars come to decide on what counted as a "biblical text," and what didn't? How did subsequent discoveries after the first cave in 1947 shape the conversation about the Bible and the Dead Sea Scrolls? What are some of the manuscripts from these other caves which help to shed light on these and other questions about the Bible, its transmission, and even its reception?

The map animation in this video was generously supplied by Lachlan Davis over at @TabletsAndTemples. He makes short, very high quality videos about the Bible and biblical scholarship. Go and subscribe!

title: Josh McDowell: Manuscript Hunting and Mythmaking for Jesus
description:
Josh McDowell is one of the most recognisable Evangelical apologists of the last half-century, and he is renowned in part for his usage of ancient manuscript studies to fortify a number of his exaggerated claims about the New Testament and Christianity. McDowell is a private manuscript collector in his own right, and he involved himself in the recent controversy surrounding the popularisation of a supposedly first-century manuscript fragment of the Gospel of Mark. Join Dr. Kipp Davis as he tracks McDowell‚Äôs history with ancient manuscripts parallel to the recent history of controversial biblical manuscript finds and forgeries, and deconstructs how he has manipulated this history to rewrite his own conversion narrative.

Dr. Kipp Davis is a senior researcher with the Lying Pen of Scribes Toppforsk project at the University of Agder. He is a specialist in early Jewish manuscripts and history, the Dead Sea Scrolls, and most recently has been on the cutting edge of forgeries research in biblical antiquities. He is widely published, and his work has been featured in popular media outlets like The Guardian, Science, CNN, CBSNews, and PBS Nova. Dr. Davis holds a PhD from the University of Manchester (2009), and presently resides and works in British Columbia, Canada.

title: Is Genesis 1‚Äì11 Reliable? A Critical Response, Part III.2: Evidence for the Documentary Hypothesis
description:
This is the fourth in my series of response videos to @Inspiring Philosophy's video "Evidence that Genesis is History and Not Myth," and the second featuring the Documentary Hypothesis. A link to the original video is posted below. Inspiring Philosophy has sought to argue for the internal consistency of Genesis 1‚Äì11 from an embarrassingly inaccurate understanding of the consensus theory of the formation of the Pentateuch from various sources, otherwise known as the "Documentary Hypothesis." In this video, I lay out a cavalcade of evidence for the source theory. This video is much longer than the others, and I felt it necessary to clearly demonstrate the total inadequacy of Jones's treatment.

title: Is Genesis 1‚Äì11 Reliable? A Critical Response, Part III: introduction to the Documentary Hypothesis
description:
This is the third in my series of response videos to @Inspiring Philosophy's video "Evidence that Genesis is History and Not Myth." A link to the original video is posted below. Inspiring Philosophy has sought to argue for the internal consistency of Genesis 1‚Äì11 from an embarrassingly inaccurate understanding of the consensus theory of the formation of the Pentateuch from various sources, otherwise known as the "Documentary Hypothesis." In this video, I illustrate the problems with his presentation of the scholarship, and also provide a brief overview of how the Documentary Hypothesis developed.



Original video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=381o2Gl5Ehc
Inspiring Philosophy's channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5qDet6sa6rODi7t6wfpg8g
Capturing Christianity's channel:  https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCux-_Fze30tFuI_5CArwSmg

title: Is Genesis 1‚Äì11 Reliable? A Critical Response, Part II (Now with Dead Sea Scrolls!)
description:
This is the second in my series of response videos to @Inspiring Philosophy's video "Evidence that Genesis is History and Not Myth." A link to the original video is posted below. Inspriring Philosophy has sought to argue for the historical reliability and antiquity of Genesis 1‚Äì11 from a set of small points‚Äîmost of which are ineffectual. In this second video I show how he has created a false dichotomy to make his case, and introduce archaeological evidence and information from the Dead Sea Scrolls to demonstrate this.

title: Is Genesis 1‚Äì11 Reliable? A Critical Response, Part I
description:
This is the first in a series of response videos to a presentation by @Inspiring Philosophy on the @Capturing Christianity YouTuber Channel titled, "Evidence that Genesis is History and Not Myth." A link to the original video is posted below. Inspriring Philosophy has sought to argue for the historical reliability and antiquity of Genesis 1‚Äì11 from a set of small points‚Äîmost of which are ineffectual. But as I demonstrate in this video, his case is invalidated by a number of significant errors in his handling of the text.
